zone.line: Or what more subtle foul & savage fiends
People the abyss, & leave them to their task.
Be it not so ... there is a secret known
To thee & to none else of living things
Which may transfer the sceptre of wide Heaven
The fear of which perplexes the s S upreme...
Clothe it in words, & bid them gird his throne
In intercession; bend thy soul in prayer
And like a suppliant in some gorgeous fane
Let the will kneel within thy haughty heart;
For benefits & meek submission tame
The fiercest & the mightiest.
Prometheus
Evil minds
Change good to their own nature. I gave all

He has , ;
& I placed it in his choice to be
The crown, or trampled refuse of the world
With but one law itself a glorious boon —
I gave — & in return he chains me h ear ere
Years, ages night & day, whether the Sun
Split my parched skin, or in the moony night—
